abstract.p: Swiss-born architect Frank Escher and his Sri Lankan partner, Ravi GuneWardena, have designed teheir second Electric Sun Salon in Sherman Oaks, Calif; photo (Currents column) (S)

block.p: Sunny Los Angeles may sound like the last place to pay for a tan, but in fact, tanning parlors here can be high art, as the Swiss-born architect Frank Escher and his Sri Lankan partner, Ravi GuneWardena, demonstrated with this, their second Electric Sun Salon. Rising to the challenge, they came up with a serenely minimal space whose decorative effect comes from the play of light. A pink glow from installed lights mingles with a turquoise wash cast by the tanning beds. The high-gloss look is finished off with red vinyl seats, a glass counter and a shiny gray-white floor. The salon, shown, just opened at 14364 Ventura Boulevard, Sherman Oaks; (818) 784-8834.
